item.title: Report X-2025030861
item.description:
Report X-2025030861

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-15
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the GEGR location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. While investigating the shipment it was discovered that the plastic bucket inside was placarded as UN2880 and the removeable lid was damaged causing the release. The outer fiberboard box did not have any DG markings or paperwork required for transport. It was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held for the FAA.

item.title: Report E-2025030191
item.description:
Report E-2025030191

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-06
  • City: SPOKANE VALLEY
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Carrier picked up the 5 gallon cube from the customer, Hollister Stier, and loaded the waste onto the truck. Driver made other pickups throughout the day. When the driver arrived at the branch, it was discovered that the waste was leaking from the cap and had contaminated another container. In-house spill response team was activated. They were able to clean up the spill and decontaminate the leaking and leaked-on package. Both items were overpacked and shipped to final destination without incident.

item.title: Report E-2025030154
item.description:
Report E-2025030154

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-07
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING SHIFTING OF A PALLET AT THE UPS FACILITY IN AUBURN, WA, A RATTLING AEROSOL SOUND COULD BE HEARD COMING FROM AN AIR FREIGHT SHIPMENT. CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS AN INNER BOX WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING. THERE ARE TWELVE FLAMMABLE AERSOL CANS INSIDE THIS BOX. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST BOX.

item.title: Report X-2025030445
item.description:
Report X-2025030445

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-03
  • City: VANCOUVER
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PRELOADER NOTICED THAT THE BOX LOOKED LIKE IT WAS LEAKING AND STOPPED THE PROGRESS OF THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER CAME TO INSPECT THE PACKAGE AND IT DID LOOK LIKE IT WAS LEAKING SOMETHING. THERE WAS NO SPILL TO CLEAN UP, THE BOX JUST LOOKED WET. OPENED THE BOX AND FOUND THAT A 1 GAL CAN OF ACRYSOL HAD A LOOSE CAP AND WAS SLOWLY LEAKING.

item.title: Report X-2025030182
item.description:
Report X-2025030182

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-27
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED.
